text: hi everyone today I'm making me quanto
Costa noodle salad this is definitely
one of my childhood favorites and the
person who make the best me Cointreau in
the world is of course my mom the other
day I posted her photo of me photo on
Instagram and so many of you were
interested in the recipes so today
finally is time for video recipe let's
begin I have here 7 ounces or 200 gram
each of trims and pop the shrimps I have
peeled and deveined and the pot belly is
kingless light we're gonna season them
separately with something shallot pepper
chicken stock about 1/2 TSP each and
teaspoon of fish sauce mix well and set
aside for about 15 minutes now in a
large wok each 4 tablespoon of extra
virgin pina oil and saute some minced
garlic shallots until really fragrant
now extra virgin olive oil is very
unique to you on our province and it's
give meat was really unique taste if you
can't find it just replace with whatever
cooking oil that you have now after
shrimps and see on both sides until they
turn pink and then transfer to a clean
plate with a slotted spoon that looks
quite a lot of oil but trust me you're
gonna need that much for this dish now
into the seasoning oil in the wok add
the seasons pop and also stir fry for
about 5 minutes so it is completely
cooked through turn the shrimp back and
add these brows and stir for about 2
minutes until is
then turn off the heat now in a mortar
and pestle crush some garlic chilies and
2 tbsp of sugar really finely here I
just crushed directly in the small bowl
[Music]
then add 4 tbsp of fish sauce and stir
until the sugar is completely dissolved
now add the flat rhino's and resource
some of the sauce adjusting to your
taste add some more hurts like mint or
basil or cilantro and mix really well
the hurts are so fresh the smells really
good
then add some crushed rotted peanuts for
more crunch and that's it is ready to
serve transfer to a serving plate and
garnish with more crush rotted peanuts
some chilli slices to make it look
really sexy and a few drops of sesame
oil to give everything a shiny look and
fragrant smell this dish is actually not
that popular but I'm sure if you try out
my mother recipe you can afford in love
with it instantly I hope you give it a
try and let me know how it turns out
this recipe together with so many other
fir and noodle recipes can be found in
my cookbook simplify which is available
